se.nicklasgavelin.util
Class ByteArrayBuffer

java.lang.Object
  se.nicklasgavelin.util.ByteArrayBuffer

public class ByteArrayBuffer
extends java.lang.Object

A byte array buffer that stores bytes and gives the ability to append new bytes easily. Based upon the Apache library ByteArrayBuffer.

Author:
Nicklas Gavelin, nicklas.gavelin@gmail.com, Lule√• University of Technology

          Create a byte array buffer with a given capacity.

Constructor Detail

ByteArrayBuffer

public ByteArrayBuffer(int capacity)
Create a byte array buffer with a given capacity. The buffer will NOT be able to go above the given capacity

Parameters:
capacity - The capacity of the buffer

toByteArray

public byte[] toByteArray(int offset,
                          int length)
Returns a specific part of the byte array. Will throw an IndexOutOfBoundException if the offset + length is larger than the capacity of the buffer

Parameters:
offset - The offset to start at
length - The length of the resulted array

indexOf

public int indexOf(byte b)
Returns the index of the first occurrence of byte b

Parameters:
b - The byte to check index for
Returns:
Returns the index of the given byte or -1 if the byte isn't in the buffer

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty()
Returns true if the buffer is empty, that is if the length is 0

Returns:
True if empty, false otherwise

isFull

public boolean isFull()

setCapacity

public ByteArrayBuffer setCapacity(int capacity)
Set the new capacity of the byte array, will keep the current data as long as the new length is larger than the current one. If the new capacity is smaller than the current capacity and the currently stored data exceeds the new capacity length the excessive data will be dropped.

Parameters:
capacity - The new capacity (may be larger or smaller)

capacity

public int capacity()
Returns the total capacity available for storage

Returns the current amount of data in the array

Returns:
The current amount of bytes

Returns:
The current amount of bytes
